Reviews.Review Text: Best seafood experience ever! We had grilled prawns with fries, seafood fried rice and seafood pizza with two cocktails. All were superb and worth the price. We were served by 'Indunil' who brought that authentic southern hospitality which made the whole experience even better. Will be definitely returning soon to this place üèñÔ∏èÔ∏è

Recently had the pleasure staying here it was great experience, locations was perfect for easy access to explore Unawattuna, food was outstanding and delicious with fresh seafood on offer, also a great friendly staff with great service, kids enjoyed the stay, surely will be back

Thaproban Beach House stands out as the premier choice in Unawatuna.

The rooms are impeccably clean, boast excellent views, and are conveniently situated near the dining area, fostering a strong connection with the staff and enhancing the beach house atmosphere. Access to the pool, gym, and massage facilities is provided via a complimentary 3-minute buggy ride to the sister hotel.

Special mention to Thilina and Priyantha for their exceptional service. They went above and beyond to celebrate a friend's 21st birthday, arranging a breakfast with decorative flowers and candles, and an evening dinner highlighted by a surprise cake and a 'Happy Birthday' message crafted from lentils.

The culinary offerings, particularly the curry and seafood, are outstanding. The seafood, noted for its freshness and quality, is a must-try.

I eagerly anticipate my return to Thaproban Beach House on my next visit to Sri Lanka, and extend my gratitude to the entire staff for their warmth, hospitality, and making our stay memorable.

Easy to access Unawatuna beach location is amazing, room was up to standard with basic amenities, doors and locks should be maintained some doors can‚Äôt lock properly and service was average need to be managed and organized proper service ,beach towels available on request or front desk ,in room shower water pressure is very poor and hot water not working consistently, staff friendly But food was average need to be improved a flavor..

We stayed across the street, didn't know they had rooms. They were very kind, we had lunch and dinner seafood, very fresh, good food. Tuna and rockfish( red whole fish) was wonderful.
Staff was very nice and helpful. Spoke English so that helped, even though my husband speaks sinhalese.
Thank you so much for making us feel welcomed. USA
Absolutely delicious food! Every dish was incredibly tasty, with vibrant colors that made them even more appealing. The place was spotless and well-organized. Highly recommended!

Busy place with warm vibes‚Ä¶ food here is so good. Very satisfied with their customer service. We visited here in October 2023 and again few days ago for my birthday. I just needed to have dinner from here on my birthday and taste was still the same. No regrets for choosing them.

Loved the experience and taste of food. Love the location and what not???

üíØ Halaal and Very Impressive Menu.

Will keep visiting in future. And even now, at this very moment,  dreaming of eating and visiting pedlar's Inn.

Super Service üëå üëç üòç ü•∞

Check photos & Video for prices and menu list, etc.

Nice place to relax. And worth the visit üíØ‚ù§Ô∏è

A must visit restaurant if you are visiting Galle fort. The atmosphere, the food, the staff, the vibe everything was amazing. Food was delicious and priced at a reasonable prices from my point of view. Nice cozy restaurant with very attentive staff.

Loved this lovely restaurant in Galle Fort. The vibe was very relaxing, nice music, decor and atmosphere. The service was very attentive and quick. The food was delicious and very appealing.  Blended drinks were fresh. Highly recommend trying if your looking for a nice atmosphere with great food.

Deluxe room (also triple) is very spacious and modern. It has a balcony overlooking the pool and partially sea view. It has good AC and wifi. The staff at reception is very friendly, the manager also attentive and communicative. The hotel offers free sun loungers on the beautiful beach. The staff from the restaurant is also friendly and attentive
The location of the hotel is perfect.
Only downsides can be the noise from all the night parties around the hotel and the different vendors on the beach.

We stayed here for 2 nights with my family with yoyng kids. This was our first stay in Sri Lanka, and they made it very welcoming. We had an early flight, so we arrived there in the morning. They greeted us with fresh face towel and refreshing juice, and they made an effort to prepare the room as fast as possible. The staff is very nice, likes to talk to you and prepares everything you want. The location is perfect, right on the beach, and the pool is in the shade in the morning and afternoon, which is good because we couldn't get our kids out of the water. The only thing missing is that the sun beds are not close enough to the sea to watch the kids playing in the water.

Good place, tasty food. A lot of big waves, that's why sometimes its not comfortable for swimming, however its not a hotel problems  üòÅ
And every Sunday its very loudly because of the  party near hotel :(

Great spot for lunch on the beach.
Excellent service and good value.

Stayed here 18 years ago when it was a couple of cabanas on the beach. Great to see them thriving.

We had a bad experience here. We had a two night stay and the first night the neighbors were partying till 04:00. Nothing bad if they inform you about that the neighbors do this every weekend. But when you expect a full night of sleep, this hits you different.
Amazing restaurant food outstanding staff are so friendly.  Nice fish pond as you go in

I truly had an amazing time at Nature Trails. The key highlight of our stay, was the amazing food.Hands down one of best places in Sri Lanka where I had flavor packed good seafood !

I would highly recommend their spice infused crab curry, crispy hot butter cuttlefish and jumbo prawns that just coats your taste buds.

Not to mention their reasonably priced drinks.

The ambience of the place, hospitable staff, and attention to detail made the experience a memorable one .

In my point of view, Without any doubt one of the best and favorite hotels I stayed during my leisure and vacation time in downsouth sri lanka... Upon arrival we were warmly welcomed by the staff, and also the staff was extremely friendly, the restaurant very flexible (appreciate it) and the restaurant supervisor deserves a special gratitude. We had great experience with supperb service from Nature Trails.
And also highly Recommend to all....üß°üß°üß°üß°

Visited this place for the first time and the experience was really good. The cafe itself has a nice ambiance, with the look and feel.  The food is just great. I liked everything I tried here. Fantastic seafood ü¶û‚ù§Ô∏èü¶Äü¶êüî•
I recommend it to everyone üëåüèº

I am so happy I chose to stay at this truly unique hotel. From the delicious food, to the service and entire stay, our experience was wonderful. We had a 11 month old baby with us as well and I have to say staff and the manager were extremely accommodating making sure she was comfortable as well.

Rooms: We stayed in double and triple rooms which were spacious and clean. I particularly loved how all the room accents & colors, the view from the room facing the Rumassala hill and the hotel surroundings matched with their whole ‚Äúnature trails‚Äù theme. Very calm and relaxing. We didn‚Äôt get a chance to use their pool but saw quite a few guests it enjoying it as well.

Food and drinks:The food was the highlight- fresh and full of flavour. Don‚Äôt forget to have their amazing fried rice with the famous sri lankan hot butter cuttle fish and juicy prawns, truly amazing. I also had a craving for authentic sri lankan cuisine of rice and curry/ string hoppers and even this lived up to my expectations with the taste and freshness. There was also a Thai prawn curry that we had ordered which I enjoyed most of all. Drinks were quite reasonably priced as well.

Service: Very attentive, friendly and hospitable staff. I also appreciated how the staff went to great lengths to keep the place tidy and clean especially with pandemic concerns these days. There are sanitizer dispensers wherever needed and the common washrooms for the dining rooms were cleaned a few times. The manager and staff were ever ready if we had any questions or concerns to help out

Overall, a great place to stay with family and definitely will be our first choice on our next visit to Sri Lanka!

Name: Fort Fifty Inn Guest House & Restaurant
Address: 50 Leyn Baan St, Galle 80000, Sri Lanka

Reviews.Review Text:
This little guesthouse in Galle advertised itself as having luxury rooms with balconies.
When I arrived I was shown to a small airless room not only without a balcony but with no proper window. The shower room was poorly decorated with no shelf or proper fittings. Although I was staying two nights the room was not cleaned during my stay.
On the plus, side the double bed was comfortable and there was good air con. The breakfast had reason able choice and quality.
T he location is very good near the  lighthouse and ramparts walk.
The owner does not take cards and is somewhat reluctant to give a receipt for cash.

We have stayed one night last August. Unfortunately, this was the bad experience ever.

Not recommended for anyone to stay. Because, Bathroom smells bad and very small. No carpets. Bed sheets and pillows are not clean. Towels are old.

They were provide us the wrong wifi password and poor signal level in room No. U2 & U3.

Breakfast is good, but not enough.

We felt that they treat locals and foreigners to different ways.

The price was pretty good. Stayed there last night with my husband Kyle.
The manager is super sweet and friendly.
The room was clean, the A/C works perfectly, the washroom is clean too.
I recommend this place.
Breakfast was really good!!
5 stars!!

A nice place at a convenient location. Worth for the price.
The manager was really friendly and the service was excellent.

However, the place needs a face-lift. Everything looks old and tends to break, even the fittings in the bathroom.
The room was not the same as we booked. There are no real balcony rooms here. Yet, it's worth for the price.

We stayed two nights with kids here. Everything besides air conditioning was broken. There was also bad small in the first room we slept in. We asked to change and the friendly stuff satisfied our request. However the 2nd room was smaller and the 2nd bed was broken, but there was no smell, so I suppose I got what I've asked for..
Location is very good though. So of you are looking for smth cheap, it might be a strategic choice.
Breakfast was eggs and toast with chemical jam and margarine. Not even a fruit plate.

Name: Love Bar & Bunnies Garden Restaurant
Address: Unawatuna, Yaddehimulla Rd, Galle 80000, Sri Lanka

Reviews.Review Text: We ate an evening buffet here. The brown rice was crawling with ants. The rest of the curries were ok for the price 900rupees each. But they added 10% service charge‚Ä¶.not sure what for as it was a help yourself buffet and there was no service involved. Probably wouldn‚Äôt recommend to a friend.

Quite cozy place, close to main beach. The food and service all right. There was no AC, but now I know that in other rooms AC was available. During our stay there was no hot water till the last day. The last day suddenly hot water appeared :-) but generally the water was a little bit brown. Beds were comfortable. Breakfast big enough and tasty. The hosts were so nice and offered us last day very early breakfast, because we had a morning bus.
Good place to eat fresh catch fish, the guys put their soul in it, super basic and super friendly, honest food and very funny couches to chill

This garden is paradise üòç ‚ú®Ô∏è
Beautiful flowers, birds, calm atmosphere
I stayed here for 2 mounts, and i really felt like home üè°
Great staff, cleanest rooms in Una, charming garden, tasty breakfast, 2 minutes to the beach. Italian coffee.

This place is just superb. I was amazed with everything about this place.
The couple that runs this place are very warm and super helpful. I felt like home and even choose to have all my dinners with them. I will surely return with my family cause this is a classic place to stay in Galle. Thanks a lot to the couple for making me feel  at home.

Nice and clean room in big house.
The couple of host is very Kind and helpfull. They have all amenities (iron, hair dryer, micro wave...).
The breakfast is very good and copious.
The guesthouse is located about 8 minutes from the Fort by TukTuk.
My husband was sick and they help us to find hospital and TukTuk.
We recommand to use Pick me. Is the best way to move around the city and it's cheaper than regular TukTuk
We recommend this guesthouse

Diloshi and Prasad are very sensitive and responsive hosts who helped me with all the questions that arise, they helped me get from the airport at midnight, helped to rent a motorbike, picked up to Galle Railway station and helped with a schedule of bus to airport  in Colombo and much more. Prasad every morning made a delicious homemade breakfast and if you want he can made a lunch or dinner. He worked many years in Italy and cooked very tasty meals from chicken curry to pasta. House is very beautiful, rooms are clean and comfortable with good wi-fi signal for working.
The house is located in a quiet place and a 10-minute walk to get good beach near hotel Radisson blue, the center of Galle can be reached in 10 min by motorbike or tuk-tuk where there are stores and beautiful Galle Fort. I lived here for a 3 weeks and would like to stay more. Many thanks for everything dear Diloshi and Prasad. I hope to see you again!

Diloshi and his family are so so welcoming and kind. apartment was spotless with a great shower, shared kitchen available to keep your beers cold. The breakfast every morning was an incredible feast, we even skipped lunch and dinner one day because it's so big. wifi was strong, nice balcony to hang out on. They also have a cute little pet bunny Tuwey that you can hang out with in the common area, so we'll trained and arodable. 100% recommend staying here.

My wife and I stayed at Dini Galle last weekend, they accommodated us very well, we wanted to stay longer after check out time, but they help us and they give us time and space without extra charge.  Especially if you stay here, you can feel like your home

I haven‚Äôt actually stayed here, but ordered food with Uber Eats from the Hasara hotel‚Äôs restaurant and was as disappointed as have probably never ever been. My review is about that and not about rooms. Rooms are probably fine

The food (fish and chips, onion rings) looked like it was cooked yesterday. The smell and the taste were awful, like they were all cooked in the same pan at the same time sharing all the disgusting flavours with one another. I just fed everything to the dog cause it wasn‚Äôt humanly possible to consume.

As a resume for people from the restaurant - please make sure to get some ideas about what cooking is.

Photos show comparison of a picture from Uber eats and what I actually got. I mean, it happens in other places every time as well, but man‚Ä¶

Booked a room and had a meal at the restaurant. We are tourists, so can't say much about location. We needed a place to crash for a night. It was painful even for just one night. Room and bathroom, not clean. Bathroom was just disgusting(our room's bathroom didn't look anything like the one in the picture as advertised). Very old bedding, and I don't think the comforters were washed in ages, towels very old, no shampoo, water would turn cold every few min, had to turn off, wait for it to wam up then continue with shower. The big sink has a tiny faucet from which water drips on edge, so you can't even wash both hands at the same time. We were told the room has wifi, but didn't.

The ladie's bathroom in the restaurant doesn't even have a faucet to wash your hands, no toilet paper. We had food at the restaurant, and we have eaten better Sri Lankan food back home. Staff were very nice and friendly, but I wouldn't recommend staying or eating here. If I had seen how discusting the public areas are, I would have never eaten here. I don't even want to think about what their kitchen looks like. 1 is the lowest star I can give. If I had the option of zero or even a negative star, I would have chosen that.
I usually only put reviews if it's positive, or I just won't put a review. But this was so bad, that I just had to warn other tourists.

Food was not good as expected. The meat chop seuy was included chicken, pork and sausages. But chunks of meat was large and gad no much flavor, they were tasted raw like raw meat. Egg fried rice was full of leek chops not with much eggs. üòê
Customer service was good and waiter was friendly. üòä
Enjoyed the new karaoke room, had the time of my life, singing my heart out. Such a great place to go with friends and family. Definitely recommend and will be going back.

Food and staff was  very good.
Very close to Galle city center.

Terrible experience. Ordered the Sundae ice cream... Well the pictures speak for themselves. That's not what I call a sundae... What a joke. So they advertise something they don't actually sell. The ice cream they have us is... 80 grams... So super tiny!

After almost 5 year I recently visited this place and it was very sad to see that the interior was vary bad. Washroom was not maintained properly. There was a bad smell around the cashier. Place was not cleaned properly. A/C was not working properly. Please take some action to make this place better because this is the only KFC around Galle and lot of foreigners visit here expecting a good experience.

My family is not to first time taking foods in
KFC,this branch is very bad,we take chicken submarines and more things here,but all are not fresh,I think they are got cheese in the freezer & took to bun,not heating up.We order our meal and pay & we went to sit,when we sitting they were ready our meal,how did it withing like 3 mins????????My baby was 1 1/2 years old,he eat this bun & he was vomiting,how we come again to KFC galle??? I don't like recommended this KFC branch.And also want to say,customer service very bad.

This place doesn't deserve at least one star. Hope KFC franchise in Sri Lanka should revoked their license. We ordered 2 double decker burger meals and the oiliness of the chicken is too much. The chicken drumstick is literally dripping oil. The burger buns is wet and not even properly toasted. The service here is terrible and the way they serve food is disgusting. If you visit galle please avoid this place. There are other awesome places in galle to have a proper meal.

AVOID AT ALL COST!!! It doesn't even deserve one star. Place is completely mismanaged. 2 managers on shift couldn't sort out some man's receipts for an hour. Other staff just kept walking around pretending not to see the cue of clients. We have waited 45 mins to order! THE SLOWEST fast food EVER. DO NOT expect any kind of quality food. It was awful.
Dirty tables, rubbish everywhere. And bathrooms were horrific, absolutely filthy, I have never seen place so badly managed in every way.
AVOID!!!

Great food with excellent service we had the 3 course set menu which was great value for money. It's only 100m from the Unawatuna beach seafood restaurants. All Jewelry have highest standards of quality and value for money
Really enjoyed our stay. The owner was very helpful and gave us info on where to go and arranged a scooter for us. Definitely stay again.
good
Our friends were vacationing here and we went to visit them, we really liked it.
Everything is beautiful in the photo, in life everything is different

A decent spot to have an incredible dinner. Open kitchen. Exceptionally delectable food and I love the spot. The staff were amicable and they treated us so well. In reality we didn't needed to stand by long. Wanting to visit there once more.

stopped by for a late breakfast. We took rice with veggies (1300), the rice was covered with lots of large chunks of cooked veggies and lots of delicious sauce. A cheese and tomato sandwich was actually two triangular 4-layered sandwiches with cheese, tomato, cucumber, salad and sauce with fries and sauce aside (1200). Ice coffee was pretty good too. Check the menu in other comments, it‚Äôs accurate. Owners were very kind. Lovely place!

Hasitha was a grate host and food was delicious.  I tried chicken fried rice and hot butter cuttlefish.  Both were very freshly prepared and served while hot n steaming.  I would definitely recommend.
cheap and good good. neat and quaint cafe with outdoor sitting and attached ice cream shop. fried calamari was served very quickly  cheese kottu was scrumptious but very filling!
Just stopped by for lunch! We enjoyed a yummy kottu and calamari. Would recommend stopping by. Very fresh juices too thank you Cafe Hula Hula
Good budget place to stay at Galle.. Near to the highway and to the town as well. Has a good beach infront of the hotel.
Very courteous service.  Good tasty foods. Rooms are bit old. But clean. Very good for a private small group gathering.
There are A.C. rooms for reasonable prices. There is a safe beach. An average quality place. Food is average quality.
Very kind staff, clean room, simple... like my home. I can just recommend
There is no dilena beach resort any more

Name: Sahana Restaurant
Address: 56A Hirimbura Cross Rd, Galle 80000, Sri Lanka

Reviews.Review Text: The number one delicious üòã egg rolls and tasty fish rolls at galle city the place is very near by karapitiya general  hospital üè•, if you‚Äôre visiting hospital the after find this restaurant for tasty Sri Lankan style rolls or snacks with coffee or tea, friendly staff with clean tables and much space for groups,recommend for hit there Sri Lankan taste snacks
Fresh food for a reasonable price, even the tea is very good. Some beverages like faluda and food like Chinese rolls are worth a try

Freshly made short eats and baked items available throughout the day. Reasonable prizes for big portion. Taste is good. Clean place. Professional staff. Can make bulk orders in advance. Large indoor parking space as well!
üçîü§î Tasty food that leaves you feeling like a detective! üïµÔ∏è‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏èüß™ Are they secretly cooking up chemistry experiments in the kitchen, spicing up those rolls and pastries? üß™ü§Ø

I give overall 5 stars considering all the other places of their business as well. Food is quality and reasonably priced. This branch was not much crowded, so you have a good place to eat without being disturbed or disturbing others.

Name: P&S (Perera & Sons) - Galle Bus Stand
Address: No. 36 Gamini Mawatha, Galle 80000, Sri Lanka

Reviews.Review Text:
Close to Galle Bus Station...
The outlet was very clean though i was there during the busy hours..
Their date muffin and chicken bun was recommendable...
The price seems to be reasonable as well..
Friendly service

Good to have a quick snack which is worth for the price.
Place is clean and the staff also friendly.
Cash and Cards accepted.

There is no wash room inside.

This is located close to the fort. They serve bakery products like cake, sandwiches, puff and few other items. The food was average. They also do have drinks like milo, orange juice. The staff is friendly and helpful. Parking could be an issue for 2 wheelers.
I bought fried rice at 6.30pm. It only had normal white rice with 1 chicken pieces , chillie paste with Spoiled vegetable chopsey. At least the rice didnt had any single carrot leeks. Very unworthy

I tried this restaurant, and the food was just okay. üòê Unfortunately, there was no toilet, which made the experience not so great. üöΩ Giving it one star because having a toilet is pretty important for everyone. Hope they improve this for future customers! üëé

This little gem was started in 1932 for the locals to eat- breakfast, lunch, dinner, tea, snacks & still continues to cater to mostly locals. During my 5 days  visit to Galle I've eaten here almost everyday- breakfast, lunch, & afternoon tea. The food is delicious & authentic  local food.  If you are willing to ignore the looks from the outside & go in to eat some home cooked food you'll love it. You will see a lot of locals eating here. Food is served on a clay plate üòÑ eat with your hands so lick your fingers.. it's finger licking good. Most breakfast and lunch dishes are cooked & ready to be served. I don't think you can customise the spice levels.. another good thing for local immersion experience üòÅ

Amazing ambience, good food and a must visit in Fort.
This is not my first time here. The ambience and decor has always been great and upgraded every time I come here. The place is special because this is the oldest tea room in the fort and is currently run by the owner/founder's 3rd generation. The shops deco is vintage with historical memorabilia of galle and Volkswagen (because it's the owners favourite brand)
The food has always tasted good and as i remember it throughout the years. The portions are big but the pocket stays the same size, because the food does not cost much. They have a buch fo short eats, meals and beverage options.
They even have the classic Highland "kal kiri" glass bottle milk and multiple flavoured ice packets.
since most people walk inside the galle parking won't be a concern but there is indeed parking near the place.

A cozy, family run tea room where you can have breakfast and lunch. Lovely people who makes you feel at home immediately. I only had tea, egg roll and a small breakfast but all was delicious and I will definitely go back again, when in Galle. Great quality food for  very reasonable prices. Very nice, homey atmosphere.
Worth having  a try at their special dish 'Shakshuka 'with bread. Reasonable prices. Good  vibe.

Excellent breakfast, delicious and healthy. Will never forget the amazing paan with parippu and sambol.
Thank you Mr. Chiranth and family, for your kind hospitality.

Arrived in Galle at mid afternoon and we were hungry for lunch. We remembered this place from three years ago and decided to eat here again.
Review: Great food, tasty, well prepared food and plated, but bad service.
Waiters don‚Äôt show up. You have to keep looking for them and ask them for service. We also have to ask them to clean our table.
#foodreview #galle #gallefort

We were looking for a very nice seafood and found this one with a lot of reviews. We came for the meal on new year eve. However we found that is was only a mediocre experience. Food was just average. Portions are small for the price. Service was not impressive at all.
It was a delight for your palate ‚Äì one of the best seafood experiences we've ever had. Visiting Galle for this culinary adventure is truly worthwhile.

Beautiful cosy atmosphere with a contemporary looking interior. Dishes served in a very attractive manner, obviously prepared by a chef with a good culinary skill. Sea food cooked, just right. I think the spice levels might go well with Western eating abilities.

I actually did a cooking class here. The food we cooked was delicious. Once cooked it was served in the restaurant. If what we cooked is a reflection of the restaurant food, I would highly recommend this place.  The ambiance is very eclectic.

Name: Domino's Pizza - Galle
Address: No.43 Colombo Main Rd, Galle 80000, Sri Lanka

Reviews.Review Text: Tried Domino's new Mexican Cheesy Rice and loved it! The taste was amazing‚Äîrich, cheesy, and flavorful. Only downside was that it took 30 minutes to be served. Worth the wait for such a delicious dish!

Today is big offer due to independence day
Crowded in the evening
But provided satisfied service
5 minutes, delaying for online order.
But not an issue because , we enjoyed the online order at Domino's
=====

Visited here for HSBC offer.
More offers available for selecting.
6 tables with 4 seats and a special 6 seats table available on the ground floor.
Limited car park and able to park vehicles on both sides of the main road ( free parking).
satisfied taste .
Bday parties can be arranged.
Actually reasonable prices and different types of promotions. Able to customize your pizza as per your choice with additional charges ( not much )

They don't serve dinein orders to our table we have to go and bring them and they don't even provide paper serviettes for the pizza.Very poor customer service.Portion of the large pizza is not enough.Not recommend.

Food is good , Fair price. Staff is ok. They dont charge service charge like the other famous  pizza brand. Compared to other pizza brand their large pizza seems to be small though.  I have a little concern about atmosphere, If you concern about the atmosphere 1st floor is not ideal. But ground floor is ok. I recomond this.
Delicious pizza was offered for a reasonable price. Overall experience was good.

Name: Fort Bazaar
Address: Fort Bazaar, 26 Church St, Galle 80000, Sri Lanka

Reviews.Review Text:
Amazing Service, Immaculate Rooms With fresh and beautiful interiors, And delicious food, especially the breakfast!
Having stayed there for more nights than I expected to I discovered that this gem that I had dined in before was also a fantastic place to stay.
Needless to say I have continued to frequent the establishment, both by myself and with my family. We have also taken extended family and friends there for lovely meals.
The courtyard is beautiful in the evening. All round I highly recommend it.

‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è

My stay at FORT BAZAAR was excellent! The food was incredibly tasty and well-prepared, with nice arrangements that made each meal a delight. The staff were very kind, helpful, and attentive, adding a personal touch to the experience. The prices were reasonable for the quality provided. Overall, a wonderful place to stay. Thanks, FORT BAZAAR! üòçüî•

Our stay here was exceptional. Rooms were cozy, food was delicious and the service received from the staff was amazing. There was a happy hour from 5 to 6 and we could order complimentary wine, beer cocktails and the kids can have soft drinks. We‚Äôd love to visit this place again.

We had the best vacation at Fort Bazaar! We travel in a group of 6. It‚Äôs not easy to meet the demands of a group but the staff at teardrop did so effortlessly, service was exceptional and so was the quality of food! We booked on BnB but ended up having all our meals here. I would recommend this property to all my friends!

We stayed there for one night and the entire experience was really good. the staff is very caring and very helpful. The food was delicious. they provide a really good service for both foreign and  local guests.
Very nice restaurant in the Fort Bazaar Hotel. I liked sitting on the veranda very much. Halloumi starter was ok. Fish curry was excellent. Service team is fun and attentive.

While the location was fine, the food and the service were not. We had to wait a long time before anyone took notice of us to be seated. Staff was hanging at the bar inside. While our table was reserved, it had to be prepared while we were seated. They forgot our napkins and we had to go inside to ask for them. Wine on the menu that we ordered, was not available. The main course of my partner existed of just one piece of fish and a bowl of dry white rice, nothing else. No vegetables, no sauce, nothing. When we complained, they said sorry but told us this was their normal way of serving. When we ordered dessert, we had a chance to check the menu description for the main course which showed more ingredients that were simply forgotten by the chef. The ice cream for dessert was mostly melted when it finally arrived. My ‚Äòclassical lemon tart with meringue‚Äô tasted ok, but was extremely small. In our view this restaurant is highly pretentious, but lacks the real quality that might be expected for the LKR 18.000 (including a service charge of 33%!) that we had to pay.

Nice place to sit on their front patio and have a drink, they have a happy hour from 5-6pm on lion beer, wine and one of their daily cocktails. Their hotel restaurant inside looked busy and the service is a bit slow, but did enjoy their sea bass which was very fresh, and the chicken tikka was also very nice but the chicken a bit over cooked.
We had the pizzas, panini and ravioli and everything was amazing! They were very accommodating to vegetarian options as well. Very lovely staff and amazing service

Hidden gem in Galle Fort! The most delicious food and great customer service. Stumbled into this restaurant by accident, and we couldn‚Äôt be happier. The staff were so welcoming and hospitable, even though we arrived 15 mins before the kitchen closed. You can‚Äôt go wrong with their Asian dishes.
Honourable mention to their salted mango smoothie ü•≠

Name: Asian Jewel Boutique Hotel @ Restaurant
Address: Lane 3 Field View Road Nalagasdeniya, Baddegama Rd, Hikkaduwa 80240, Sri Lanka

Reviews.Review Text:
we did not stay but went fir dinner. During a recent stay at our villa in Hikaduwa, another couple recommended a quaint little restaurant known for its exceptional curry plates. Intrigued, we decided to book a table in advance, and I'm thrilled we did! We opted for a variety of curry dishes including chicken, prawn, and seafood. To our delight, the portions were generous, easily satisfying three hungry diners with some of the most delicious flavors we've encountered.

The restaurant is a bit off the beaten track, which added to the charm and adventure of the evening. We found ourselves double-checking the directions, but it was well worth the journey. As we were the only guests that night, the service was outstanding‚Äîattentive and personal, making us feel like VIPs.

For those looking for an exceptional dining experience in a cozy, less-traveled locale, this is the place to go. Be sure to book ahead and prepare to be amazed by their superb curry plates. Highly recommend for an unforgettable evening!

We went for lunch and we were not disappointed! Definitely deserves the great reviews, the food was amazing! Location is beautiful. Away from the heat of the beach and main road and overlooking a stunning lake.
Such a nice change from the beach restaurants. 100% coming back üòä

We went for Sunday lunch and it was absolutely amazing food . Had a day by the pool in a fantastic location with superb views and the staff and food are absolutely amazing two days later went again for homemade steak pie , this hidden little boutique hotel is gorgeous the best food in the whole of Sri Lanka a definite must , the owner and staff cannot do enough for you , definitely recommend the Asian jewel

The location of the Asian Jewel is perfect if you are looking for peace and tranquility, but a short 10 minute Tuk Tuk journey takes you to the lively beachfront and bars. On arrival and throughout our stay at the Asian Jewel staff were friendly and keen to ensure that your stay was enjoyable. Our room was large with plenty of storage space, a ceiling fan, and air conditioning, the bathroom was large with a bath and a shower, a large balcony with uninterrupted views over a large lagoon provides a wonderful observation area of the boundless wildlife found in this area. Access to the rooms is via an outside staircase with no lift. The food is excellent, breakfast consists of either fruit salad or a thick smoothie, followed by a large choice ranging from, pancakes  with fruit to beans on toast to a Sri Lankan traditional fare, lunch and evening meals the choice was extensive, curries, pastas, goulash, stroganoff, fish and vegetarian dishes and even pub favourites such as sausage and mash. The pool was well maintained and easily accessible, there were a variety of wooden sun beds, with full cushions, large umbrellas and towels provided. Excursions can be booked with the manager offering a personal and hassle free option. Tuk Tuk journeys are a great way to travel, not only to the beach but also to Galle Fort, and also to the turtle conservation hatchery.

We've been twice for food at the Asian Jewel. Our first order was battered prawns' chips & salad. Shepherds pie with boiled veg & gravy.
Second order was the Mega English breakfast & Sri Lankan Omelette. Both visits the food has been to a very high standard and very tasty. It's a little off the beaten track but well worth going. The setting is beautiful' overlooking the Lagoon. Whether you're looking for a taste of home (UK) or traditional Sri Lankan food' this place is a must. The staff are all very polite and attentive.

Athula beach is more of an eatery but located in the central Hikkaduwa . The dining area is facing the beach and to your right you could see the Hikkaduwa fishing port. The food  quality is satisfactory and the service was good. Koththu is my recommended food. I would also recommend trying out the dinner menu more than the lunch menu.
Good place,good staff in there and good sea view.foods are very tased

Breakfast is terrifying. Believe me, there are a lot of places with clean plates.
Auwful music with advertisment is included. No chance to enjoy ocean sound
Prices are good btw

I am always happy to pay a "tourist surcharge", but this host took it to the top by giving us a ridiculous exchange rate.This way we had to pay 20% more than we agreed up on. When pointing this out, and showing him the actual exchange rate, he got really angry. Again, paying a bit more and having a bad exchange rate is fine, but being angry and 20% more is just a rip-off!
Just here to get a breakfast before going to the railway station, so kind people here, beautiful beach place, chilly area. For me perfect üëç

My first visit. Can recommend for a budgetary vacation while experincing the true beauty of the beach. Location, close proximity to beach makes its the advantage. Love the untouched colonial atmosphere of the premises. Rooms are average with all needed amenities for a stay with cleanliness. Service extended by Isuru is very good and  helps to feel homely. Hoping to visit again for a longer stay during the season. Can improve on the view from the windows that open to the inside of the premises by making them a neater, tidy and pleasant  instead of the incompleted structural renovations view.

Stayed here with my partner last night and we wished we stayed longer, especially with the inexpensive price. The view was glorious as well as the hotel facilities - although the restuarant wasn't open for dinner only breakfast (but there are a tonne of surrounding restaurants). The service was smooth and helpful - they even offered freshly cut coconut and pineapple for sale. The shower had hot water which is not something I can say about the last 5 hotels we've stayed at. The mattress was a little thin for me personally as well as the curtains to block out the constant light. The mosquito net was a welcomed relief and allowed us to look out at our wonderful balcony sea view.

Curry Bowl is a beautiful old house with a stunning view from the beautiful garden. It's located on the beach, a few steps from where you can feed the turtles with seaweed. The quality of the rooms vary but they all have enclosed bathrooms and fans, most of them also have AC. The three wonderful guys who works there do everything in their power to make your stay the best! I miss my three friends already even though I left the place yesterday. I can highly recommend Curry Bowl and I will definitely go back there.

I had a lovely experience there and came back there after my surfcamp even :) Isuru and the other guys are so helpful and kind! They made the stay very enjoyable, since they are also around the house all the time. The house/room was not the newest , but if u re fine with that you can have private beach access , very calm garden and lovely service for a very great price!  They even gave me a present in the end - I will come back for sure !

Fantastic place with an excellent seaside location near Hikkaduwa Beach. The staff is incredibly friendly and helpful. If you need anything from the kitchen, the staff will gladly assist you. While the amenities may not be exceptional, they are more than justified by the outstanding location and the exceptional service of the staff. If you're fortunate, you might even spot turtles feeding on sea grass.

The location is great however the food was underwhelming considering the price.
I ordered the seafood fried rice and the hot butter calamari. The calamari was good but I found the proportions between the seafood and the rice in the fried rice to be poor. It‚Äôs a shame really because the location is really good.

Food is medium in quality. Devilled chicken is really delicious, can be recommended for anybody.  The other dishes we tried were medium in quality, for the price it is less worth. The atmosphere was calm and appealing with the sea breeze. Free Parking is available which is very convenient. Customer service is also good

A really nice bar located directly on the sea, meals are various and cheap, fruit juices are super fresh and colorful.
The waitress are kind and welcoming.
Very recommended!
The crab curry was delicious! So many beautiful layered flavours. The staff were friendly and attentive and had the best ocean views

The view is incredible you feel relaxed with the waves hitting on the rocks. The waiters are very nice and the food is delicious , the seafood is fresh too. I really recommend it and Harshawas is nice ‚ò∫Ô∏è

Name: LAGOON Hotel & Abartment
Address: Lagoon Hotel & Apartment, Kalyanawansha mawatha, Degalla, Dodanduwa,Hikkaduwa Radin Pearl Hotel, Degalla, Dodanduwa, Hikkaduwa 80250, Sri Lanka

Reviews.Review Text:
Had an amazing holiday at Radin pearl. Owner helped us for making our  holiday more precious. Every activities and everything we did here got for a reasonable price because of the owner. Rooms are clean and pleasant to stay.
Superb and amazing place for spend holiday.

The best place for Holidays
Customer service üíØ

Dilanka and Ravinat are helpful, good people! From the sky bar wonderful panoramic view of the lagoon and ocean. beautifully furnished rooms with air condition. The DARA GARAGE restaurant is only open in high season. Breakfast can always be ordered.

Name: Bluefin Adventure And Deep Sea Fishing
Address: 31 / c, Galle road Peraliya, Hikkaduwa 80240, Sri Lanka

Reviews.Review Text: This Hostel is really nice. The Room is very beautiful, the A/C is working and you have your own private beach/garden. The bathroom is really clean and i felt really comfortable there.

My partner and I were driving by Bluefin when we suddenly got a flat tire. The owner of the hostel literally came and rescued us. Without asking for anything in return he selflessly changed our tired. We even offered him money as a thank you and he turned it down! If he would do that for total strangers, I can't imagine how well he would treat his guests. While we didn't stay their ourselves (we had accom booked in Galle), I would highly recommend this gracious place.
End of last year I checked out the newly open Bluefin Sri Lanka, Hikkaduwa. I experienced their amazing brand new sea adventure and would like to highly recommend this place ‚ò∫Ô∏èüôå
Very welcoming owner and prime locations. We stayed in hammocks in his yard which was amazing
Great quiet beach right by the hostel. Super friendly host and great breakfast.
Visited the restaurant, dishes were dirty, prices on the menu were lower than in the final receipt. The ocean view is good. Unpleasant. Not recommend the restaurant.

Overlooking the ocean - had to raise our voices over the crashing of the waves, which was truly wonderful. The grilled seafood unexpectedly had sauce on it, which we didn't care for but the avocado seafood salad was outstanding if a little expensive (nearly 2,000). Sadly, the waiter asked for a tip despite 10% service already being added to our bill. Makes me think the workers don't see a penny of our extra payment.

With such amazing views I was surprised that the restaurant was empty. Nevertheless, I went in and asked if I could just have a drink. The first waiter said 'fine' and I sat down overlooking the sea. A second waiter came over, stood there and just stared at me. I asked for a Lion and he said 'just Lion'? I said 'yes please' and he continued to stand there trying to intimidate me.

Now I know why the restaurant was empty. What a bizarre experience. Needless to say, I went somewhere else.

Visited Dolphin restaurant in August 2023. There are tables with a fantastic view over the seashore. This view gave us the feeling we're in a theatre. We ordered local specialty - a big plate of grilled seafood (crab, shrimps, calamari, fish etc.) and a pot of cinnamon tea. Seafood was very rich and well cooked. Tea was nice too. My opinion is, the balcony differs this place from neighbouring cafes, so worth visiting

I dont know about hotel but here has restrant and this restaurant is sooooo nice!!we can eat seeing sunset and price is more cheper than other restaurants around here n food is very very good! I recommend seek fish! Almost three days we came here.
Robster is also cheaper than other restaurants.
And dish quantity also big.but cheap n good taste.

Name: Kalla Bongo Lake Resort
Address: Lane 3, Field View, Baddegama road, Nalagasdeniya, Hikkaduwa, Sri Lanka

Reviews.Review Text:
Had a relaxing 2 nights at Kalla Bongo. Nice location over looking the lake & away from the touristy beach side.
Rooms are clean and spacious with very good service. Will be back very soon when we are ready for a holiday.

Had a 1 night stay at this place.
Allowed early check inn as the rooms were not occupied.
Appreciate that. Situated at best location of Hikkadua though interior but managaeble.
Not the bad part, there is only one security guard at night no one else after 10.00 pm. In case of emergency you will feel the pain. If you say thats it's a resort you must have proper staff who work & night. B/f was limited & okay type.
Great location with the lake view . Rooms were good with a pleasant experience. Highly Recommended.

Super relaxed. Beautiful views from first floor rooms, but no TV, that's not much loss. Showers have little pressure. Rooms very clean. Beds have soft mattress, unusual for Sri Lanka. Nice pool. Restaurant is good, reasonable price, amazing view. Kayaks can be used for free. Nice staff.
Addendum: Apparently one of the guests left the tap on and used up the water supply. The water problem was efficiently dealt with over dinner. Thank you Melvin.

Great view from the resort! The staff also is helpful and courteous. The rooms are average, and the room services (water supply, etc.) Needs urgent repair. I think they are about to renovate so that should make things better. The overall experience can be great but I feel the rooms are a bit overpriced vs the lie condition. Do check if they have renovated the rooms before deciding to book.

Name: Thusis
Address: Nordic House, 841 Galle Rd, Dodanduwa 80250, Sri Lanka

Reviews.Review Text: Great burger, a truly homemade feel with high quality ingredients. The grilled veg was excellent too. Nice calm place to sit apart from the crazy bus drivers flying by every so often
The burger was nothing special. Sitting next to the noisy street  The service could be more friendly. It was ok but definitely not a highlight of my travel.
Delicious food, beef is amazing (rare in the island) and they listen to food sensitivities and take note
Really good burgers - proper ingredients. Friendly owner. Place is close to the street so could be noisy but can be solved by take away. I can recommend without hesitation
Excellent , friendly service with tasty burgers ....

Delicious food, nice vibe, perfect place to dine in and stay. Me and my husband are extremely pleased by the service provided. The staff was so friendly and warm. Thank you for providing such a pleasant experience. Will visit again soon.

The service was wonderful. Our waiter was so attentive and accommodating.
The food was excellent! We had cheesy pasta & cheese spaghetti and it was perfect.

Really awful pizzas, should not serve those to anyone. Really the worst ever seen. Meat lovers pizza = seafood, so misleading also.
Won't accept card payments either, otherwise the service was nice and fast.

Just a note to thank you and your staff for a very lovely evening. The food was exceptional and the service was excellent. The atmosphere was awesome and I definitely liked that you have a very modern
style. Recommended for all!!! üåüüåüüåü
Recommended place! Good breakfast and right across the street from excellent espresso. Sami who takes care of everything is a great guy.

Name: Green Shadow Wedding Hall
Address: Hikkaduwa - Baddegama Road, Pathana,, 44QF+R24, Hikkaduwa, Sri Lanka

Reviews.Review Text:
Place is good but not recently renovated visible wall patches and not working lights
Broken toilet taps and there are much flies in the hall
Food is below average level,not sevoury not much tasty.
Garden is good
Parking is good
Spacious wedding hall and a garden, good for a night outdoor function...delesious food with lot of vegetarian dishes...
Delicious food & very friendly staff. The manager is also very friendly and accommodating. The banquet hall and other facilities are also good. Can recommend!
Had a good experience. One of my cousins had his wedding function here. Food was ok.
Great place for local weddings. Great service and friendly staff. Large parking space. Nice view.

Name: Refresh Beach Restaurant
Address: 384, Galle Road, A2, Hikkaduwa, Sri Lanka

Reviews.Review Text:
If you are nearby this location and you need delicious food, this is the place for you. Its just on the beach with enough seatings available. Ambience is good. It might be very hot during the day but anything for good food.
The quantity of food is very good, so order wisely. We ordered and realized it's a lot for us, we still managed to finish as it was finger licking good. We tried butter chicken, veg fried rice, fish etc
Owner is a humble man, stopped by for a  small talk. Sweet.
Staff is good and very helpful.
Toilets are clean.
The only thing I did not like is service. It's too slow or may it's because if demand.
Visted on May 1,2024

Pretty nice place by the beach. The atmosphere here is amazing.
But pretty crowded, seems like a favourite spot for the foreigners.

We had fried rice and Kothu. They were pretty average based on our experience with the normal Sri Lankan restaurants. They are good but not the best. Kothu is filled with lots of veggies and looks healthy which is not the case normally in Sri Lanka. So let me say their kothu is healthy.

Kothu, Noodles and Fried rice options prices are affordable. If you wana try ither fancy items they are priced above average. But I think those dishes are hard to find elsewhere so they are priced right in my opinion.

I am impressed with their service, they are on time with food. With all the crowded and multiple menu items their service is very much appreciated.

They have menus in various languages. The card payments are done on the table in front of you.

Recommended if you want to try Sri Lankan cuisines and want the food on time for their good service.

Refresh Beach Restaurant offers a picturesque beachfront setting with stunning views of the ocean. The ambiance is relaxing and inviting, perfect for enjoying a meal or sipping on a cold beer while soaking in the coastal scenery. The staff is friendly and attentive, ensuring a pleasant dining experience. The menu features a variety of delicious dishes, including fresh seafood options and flavorful local cuisine. The beer selection is diverse, with options to suit every taste. Overall, Refresh Beach Restaurant is a fantastic choice for those seeking a memorable dining experience with a beach view and refreshing beverages.

We ate there 4 days in the row. The sea food is fresh and made with great teast. The place itself maybe is not "fancy," but definitely you can eat there good food in good price. The fish from grill -delicious. The same crab and lobster.
Very nice food, prawns as big as your face and the live fish sea food tanks are a very nice touch

Name: Hotel Green Garden
Address: Lake School, 44RG+97F, Junction, Pathana, Hikkaduwa, Sri Lanka

Reviews.Review Text: While the accommodations were decent, the overall experience fell short. Some ACs were off on a hot day, making the stay uncomfortable. The front yard is clean, but unfortunately, the back yard is not well-maintained. The car park is well-spaced, ensuring convenience for guests with vehicles. Overall, the staff is not particularly friendly, which detracts from the overall experience. Budget-friendly option for basic needs.
Nice plce for gatherings and occasions by  side of hikkaduwa baddegama roda
Can feel natural environment. There have quality foods. A suitable palce for spend free times. No any bothers. Have a parking. They always protect customers' private.
The main hall is opened type and not air-conditioned but fans. The food is good as well as the service. Recommend for budget weddings and other functions. They have rooms as well.

Dont book the reception hall here for your  functions. No air conditioning.  Stuffy place food is  not that good either. Avoid at all costs. Only plus would be easy access to E1 expressway via Hikkaduwa Baddegama road.

We ate here last night ~ great value, polite staff and really special Sri Lankan curry....chicken or fish with rice, popadoms and 3 vegetable dishes....850 rupees....gin and whole tonic 350....prawn curry 500. üòã yummy.

I thoroughly enjoyed the pizza at the Hikkaduwa Pizza Hut. The pizza dough was perfectly soft, and the toppings were bursting with flavor. The chicken was exceptionally fresh and not at all dry. The waitstaff provided excellent service, and it's worth noting that there are separate restrooms for both ladies and gentlemen. The parking area is spacious and convenient. I wholeheartedly recommend this Pizza Hut in Hikkaduwa for a delightful dining experience.

Honestly, we were surprised on the so many negative feedbacks. The pizza was tasty. Quality was good comparing to other places in Sri Lanka.The crew had great customer service regarding serving, kindness, asking on the spicy level and providing extra Italian seasoning. The hygiene is no1. Price was very similar to some other restaurants. We had cheesy tomato pizza and amazing cinnamon swirls. Cozy place with AC.
If you want to eat pizza (the real one, not like in Rome or Naples, of course, but surely better than the surrogates offered by surrounding cafes) come here! The best pizza in Hikkaduwa so far!

Nice place and good service.

The outdoor dining area is great and also clean , have much space than regular pizza huts. Parking space is okay
Pizza üçïüçïüçï is okay
Great pizzas for an affordable price....great atmosphere for dining in.... friendly service by the staff .....

Name: Isira Coffee Shop & Restaurant
Address: 6 Sarath Goonawardana Mawatha, Hikkaduwa, Sri Lanka

Reviews.Review Text: Very local and lovely restaurant which we were very happy to find as it opens early unlike most other restaurants in the area!! Very lovely staff and owner who was very grateful for our custom! Had a very big and tasty Sri Lankan breakfast! Even gave us complimentary pancakes with coconut and honey when we left!

So happy we found this delicious breakfast restaurant. Specially the local Sri Lanka breakfast is one of the best we had here. And super friendly people who are working here. Recommended!! We had breakfast here 5 of our 7 days.
In three days I went there twice: once for Sri Lankan breakfast and once for curry and rice. Both dishes were excellent and reasonably priced, it's worth a visit for local cuisine!
Delicious Sri Lankan food (and western options available too). The Kottu is amazing. I have been coming back here everyday. Highly recommended.
Excellent choice, especially for breakfast.  The Sri Lankan breakfast was excellent and reasonably priced.

Name: Tamara Motels
Address: 289 Tamara Motels Rd, Hikkaduwa 80240, Sri Lanka

Reviews.Review Text:
Good location - 5 minutes walk from the beach - and really kind and warm service.
This was our first hotel on our first trip to Sri Lanka, and it left a very warm impression. A modest small room for two, a tiny window behind bars and strange bed linen were not its strong point, but we found this place very atmospheric and cozy, with delicious breakfasts and everything we need, close to the beach, but at the same time surrounded by the jungle. On the third floor there is a large veranda and lines for drying clothes, on the first floor there is a shower to rinse off after the sea. The room had a safe, refrigerator, hairdryer and kettle. When it rained, the hosts thoughtfully provided us with umbrellas.
A five minute walk away is a beautiful beach with turtles. Shops, cafes and restaurants are also nearby, especially Red Lobster.
One of the inconveniences may be the railway running under the walls of the hotel, and the walls shake at night and several times a day from passing trains. But for a few days it seemed even romantic to us.
We would return to this hotel again.

We had a very large family room on the top floor.  It was cool and spacious with very comfy beds, a safe for valuables, kettle cups, glasses and cutlery.   Very useful!
It had a large and very effective fan as well as excellent aircon.
Everything was spotlessly clean.
The bathroom was amazing with hot and cold showers, great lighting and beautiful plants!
we had a private balcony with a sea view on the oneside and a shared balcony overlooking the railway tracks on the other.   There were lots of fireflies!
the trains to go right past, and are noisy, briefly, but they were no problem to us! we enjoyed watching them!
All the shared areas were covered in plants and beautifully maintained.
Our hosts were really friendly and helpful.
it's 2 -3 minutes walk to one of the little beaches suitable for swimming!

The perfect accommodation for a relaxing stay in Hikkaduwa!

The staff is very friendly and helpful. The location of the hotel is close to the beautiful beach and centrally located. Restaurants, bars and supermarkets are in the immediate vicinity.

We enjoyed our stay and can highly recommend the hotel.

Nice room and good location hotel. The room was clean enough but not perfect. The window overlooked a shared balcony, so for privacy, it had to be kept curtained most of the time. But there is a refrigerator.
There is a train track right next to the hotel and the train can be heard loud enough several times a day.
The hotel has an area with a beach shower, which was great and allowed you not to carry sand from the beach to your room. The breakfasts were good, but not very filling. You could choose what kind of breakfast you will cook the next morning from several options. The hotel also provides clean bottled water for a fee.
We had a great stay at Tamara, the family who ran the place were so hospitable and friendly. Breakfast each morning was yum and the rooms were very clean

Soup had nice sea food flavour but was little salty. Though Fried prawns were in good quantity, they charge it accordingly. Restaurant charged 2k+ SLR for fried prawns.. Difficult for two people to finish it. Served nice desert.
The service received was excellent. The seafood fried rice is very delicious and It is big enough for two people. And also the seafood spaghetti was also very tasty.

Their special seafood soup is very special indeed, and the best one we had in Sri Lanka!
Grilled Octopus, Garlic Prawns were amazing. All portions are huge, enough to share for 2. We didn't take the seafood plate, but we saw a lot of couples taking it - it's definitely more than 2 people can eat!

First off: very dirty. The table cloth was super dirty, we asked for a fresh one and he brought one from a drawer, but it was dirty too. We tried getting past that since the food on the tables looked generally good.
There was smoke at the top floor - horrible- and the music was very loud.
The food is not good.
The barracuda and calamari were overcooked. The veggies were the highlight of the "fish and veggies" dish.
The octopus had a weird sauce. The grilled is not actually grilled.
The lobster is yet another story.
After ordering 2 of 1 kg, they said it would be 30 min to get our food. After 1h they came to say they're out of 1kg lobster, they only have 1.5kg lobster...after 1 h!
My husband was already fuming and started arguing that it is unacceptable to wait so long and then say you're out of the thing we ordered, they should have said something earlier. They ended up not charging 3kg for 2 Lobsters, but 2 kg. But the fact remains, they were trying to blame us for wanting grilled. I would not set foot here again.

I have been to The Red Lobster twice (January 2012 & March 2018). Both of those times it didn't shatter my anticipation to taste a good bite.
Rice is in the excellent form you can order from a variety of dishes full of tasty bits.

Name: Moon Light
Address: no a 337 A2, Hikkaduwa, Sri Lanka

Reviews.Review Text:
I ordered 5 dishes, they‚Äôre on the snip of the receipt.
The one I liked the most was the Seafood Rice (photo also attached) the one that the waiter had offered to try after my request for his advice)
So try seafood rice, or ask the waiter for advice. They seem to know their menu well.

The other two salads and omelette were quite average, seems like they aren‚Äôt cooking them too often.

The service is nice in general, but waiting times are quite extensive during the peak hour, I was there around 2pm.

I highly recommended the sizzling dishes they have! I got the sizzling prawns and it was soooooo good üòã I also ordered paratha with it that was NEXT LEVEL. The pizza was okay but not great. The location is really good because it‚Äôs easy to walk in either direction from it.

The best curry and rice we had in the 3wks we had in Sri Lanka. We shared that and a crab curry between the two of us and it was my favourite meal of the trip.

I‚Äôve read that this restaurant gets too busy in the evenings but we were there for lunch and there were no problems.
One of the best meals I've had in a while. Beautiful seafood platter for two. Great service and reasonable prices. Thank you.

Moon Light restaurant offers delicious food with generous portions that are worth the price.
The prawn soup, brown onion soup, wraps, and spaghetti I ordered were all flavorful and well-prepared. The soups, in particular, were a highlight of the meal.
The service provided was satisfactory, with attentive and friendly staff.
Despite the small size of the place, it didn't hinder the enjoyment of the food.
However, an area for improvement is the lack of card payment acceptance. It would be beneficial for the restaurant to consider introducing card payment options.
Overall, Moon Light restaurant provides a tasty dining experience

This place is absolutely Amazing, simple and beautiful, super friendly people, and food oh My Gosh.. really tasty! mango Curry my favorite, and the view from the Balcony!
People super helpful!! If you are in Hikkadua you Must to Go! Amal, the Rasta! Forever in my ‚ù§Ô∏è.

It literally doesn't get any better than this. I almost don't want to do this review because this bar is so amazing and chilled I want to keep it to myself. But they deserve a great review because it's a great place.
Just amazing place, view, service, vibes, music, atmosphere üíïüíïüíï Love it and highly recommend
Amazing venue, watched a few sunsets here. Hidden gem! And one of the best curry's I've ever eaten ü§§ decent cheap drinks as well.

Perfect location on the beach. Delicious food that won't disappoint. We had grilled chicken, perfectly marinaded, prawn curry which was second to none and even the tomato and cucumber salad was mouth watering. The staff are friendly and genuine and gave great service. Highly recommend!

Name: Celestial Inn Mirissa
Address: Shortcut to Beach, Mirissa, Sri Lanka

Reviews.Review Text: It is not a place with great luxuries, but the location is excellent, the staff is very friendly and helpful. I stayed there for a week and they helped me with everything, you can even ask them about tours and transfers. It is special to mention the work of Trishan, who was very attentive!

Very basic accommodation at a high price for SL during the holiday season. Rooms were very basic. First room we were put in simply had the beds and the bathroom, then we were moved to a room that had some room decor and a kettle. Limitations of the rooms are 1-2 powerpoints and no mosquito nets. There were mosquito's in one room and alot of ants in the second. Rooms weren't cleaned for us during our 4 day stay, if they were it would have made it alot more comfortable.

Please do not be fooled by the high rates. This hotel is a Must Avoid. I spent three nights in the facility and it was the most expensive facility I stayed in during my vacation. Unfortunately, the photos are not correct.
Hotel needs renovation
Rooms are dirty and full of humidity ( pillows were rotten green)
The smell of humidity is terrible.
Bathing water is mild ,no hot water available
No shampoo, no kettle, no water bottles, no team no coffee, nothing.
No room service
Garbage bin was not cleaned for three days
This hotel is not worthy the money you pay
The only good thing is the location as they are close to Mirissa beach.
Worst place I stayed in during my vacation in Srilanka
A bit basic, could use some tlc. The power was off at night which left us with no fan or Aircon, and with no mosquito net we were vulnerable.

The rooms are quite large and the bed very comfortable. Room has everything like electric kettle, mini bar, hair dryer, AC. Except TV.
Bathroom is also big. Place is very clean and calm.The breakfast served in the morning is delicious. Mirissa beach is just a minute away.

Best part is this place is Nadik and Posunda. Nadik is a kind of manager of this place and Posunda is his younger brother. Ther are fabulous. Very hardworking and caring. Always wearing smile on face. Ready to help any time in day and night.
Nadik is a well educated guy. Always keen to know that what's happening around the world.
Hotel has small beautiful Luss green  garden where you can sit and feel relax.

Name: Paradise Beach Club
Address: 140, Ven. Gunasiri Mahimi Mawatha, Mirissa 81740, Sri Lanka

Reviews.Review Text:
- The room was moderately clean.
- The bathroom was very dirty, with mold in some corners.
- The toilet had a sanitized seal, but upon lifting the seat, it was evident that fecal remnants from the previous user were still present on the seat. Although the hotel sent a staff member to clean it, there was no further follow-up from them.
- The food was also just mediocre.
- What is truly excellent is the view, the pool area, and the proximity to the beach. Honestly, I would recommend waiting on a stay at this hotel. Instead, consider paying the 1000 lkr fee to use the pool and the beach loungers and opt for a guesthouse instead, which costs just a fraction of the price.

The rooms are basic but comfortable. Nice balcony overlooking pool. You can see the beach from top floors.
Restaurant dinner was highly weighted to south Asian cuisine.  Breakfast was amazing.

Pool bar and snack menu offerings are good and decent price.
Reception are hard to communicate with.  And often more interested in their phones and personal conversations than the guests in front of them.

Hotel does accept day visitors (paid) and is right on the public beach - so don‚Äôt relax too much about your possessions.

The pool is large and well kept.  The pool furniture good quality too.

Definitely will suggest this place and return again.

Rooms are large. Bedding clean and comfortable.  We were in room 203, where air-conditioning was inadequate, requiring us to use the overhead fan. Room 203 has a lovely sea view. Meals were good and varied catering to all palettes. Staff were helpful and courteous.

A very poor excuse for a hotel‚Ä¶ paradise is the last word I would use to describe this place. Thick mould in the bathroom, broken ceiling fan, average lunch. We were booked to stay 3 nights but checked out within 3 hours of our arrival. Don‚Äôt believe the photos on the website they are probably 15 years old‚Ä¶ the place is a disgrace !

It all started when the staff at the reception deceived us. Will indicate a cost of $140 per night. We checked the booking price and this man said that he agreed to $100, he did a favorüôÅ His moment was disgusting. The staff here makes no attempt to retain customers; they roll their eyes at requests. We stayed for 2 days to relax by the pool. But living here wasn‚Äôt worth it, it was better to just come here and that‚Äôs it. The rooms themselves are spacious, there is a closet and plenty of storage space. There was a bad drain in the shower and everything was overflowing. The floors in the room are poorly cleaned, there is sand in the corners.   Breakfasts and dinners are normal. I was also struck by the fact that there is a charge for water in the room, I pay quite a lot for my stay and they also ask me for 400 rupees for one bottle. I will not return to this hotel again and will not recommend it. the team needs to work on the service.

Name: New Bay View Villa
Address: 251/29A, Bandrawatta, Kapparatota, Weligama, Weligama 81700, Sri Lanka

Reviews.Review Text: The direct view on the sea makes the hotel a relaxing place to stay. Direct access to the sea for snorkelling or surfing is a +. Weligama and Medigama can be reached within 10 min by motorbike. Good availability of the hotel staff üëèüèΩ

Located perfectly just outside weligama, with its own private beach and a great view of the sunset. The best part is the staff. So friendly and helpful, doing everything with a big smile and appreciation. Will definitely be back.

The best kept secret in the area. Perfect for surfers but only. Private beach - amazing view.
Excellent food, rich menu.

The most amazing experience I‚Äôve had staying in Sri Lanka.

To start off, the rooms are gorgeous and I got an amazing room with a sea view that was awesome waking up to every morning. The cleaning staff made sure the room was extremely clean and welcoming, and even helped me do my laundry as well while staying here!

Secondly, the food was the best I‚Äôve had in Sri lanaka. It was absolutely incredible and the chefs are magicians - they have some of the most delicious sea food (lobster üòã), Shakshuka, and breakfast one could ask for! I tried a couple other places in the area but none compared to what the chefs made here and I ended up eating here for all my meals!!

Lastly, the people are all so welcoming and nice and really treat you like family. They take pride in their work and made my experience amazing.

Could not recommend this place more for anyone considering staying down south! The surfing and scuba diving in the area are also top notch!! ‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è

Nice calm place. Owner Mr Ranga is a helpfull decent person. Can arrange anything with discuss .. visit hotel. You will get nice experience with the service .. staff Kasun is a very friendly to fulfill your needs.

We had 2 great weeks at Lion's Rest. Fantastic staff and with Steve and Ayesh a really helpful attentive local management. We always felt very confortable and welcome, the family rooms are spacious and very handy, the location right in front of the surf spots very convenient, and the vibe in and around the hotel very cool. Can defininately recommend.

Another wonderful holiday in Sri Lanka staying at The Lion's Rest. Third time to Lion's rest and was brilliant as always. The rooms are modern and clean, the food is great and the staff make it extra special a big shout out to Steve and Roz who were so warm and friendly and all the guys Ayesh, Prasaad, Kalhara and the rest of the team. Always a great holiday and right on the beach. Thank you guys xxx

Great little hotel right next to the surf and amazing sunsets. The food and cocktails were also delish! Ayesh was outstanding. Excellent wifi if you need to work. Try to book room 2, a little more expensive but well worth it to look at the ocean from your bed. Thanks Mike and Steve. Cool little spot.

Relaxed and friendly. This hotel is in a hotels area. Nice beaches around. Easy to get there by bus from Galle or Matara. Swimming pool is not the cleanest you will not wish to swim there, but who needs a swimming pool when the see is 100 meters away. The rooms are clean and well climatised (loved that part).

Being a non surfer my wife & I still enjoyed our 2 week stay in this hotel. The staff were brilliant, we had the best room with private deck looking out to the surfers in front and my coffee would be delivered there each morning by the friendly staff.
Best whale watching

Name: forrestvilla
Address: diniya midigama weligama, AH 43, Sri Lanka

Reviews.Review Text: We rent a scooter, all is perfect and the owner is very friendly and kind, i suggest it for all!

This is the third time I have stayed in this villa. I always stay for a month ‚ô•Ô∏è

I love the caring family Indra and Maria.‚ú®

I have traveled all over SriLanka and the villa in the photo is by the most beautiful beach I have ever seen.  Sea is full of turtles! üê¢ Midigama is the ideal place to relax and not be surrounded by tourists!

üåäüèÑ‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏èüèÑ‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏èPerfect waves for surfing right outside the house!

Thank you!
Wery good
Brilliant place .dreaming to be their again
Dirty and they cheated me out of 3000 rupees. After a month of living, the jeans were covered with mold. I don't recommend it. Although the hosts are very friendly.

Name: Angel Rest & Restaurant
Address: No: 158 Harbour Road, Mirissa 81740, Sri Lanka

Reviews.Review Text: DO NOT STAY HERE. I booked this place and it was confirmed via a third party site. When I arrived it was pouring with rain and the owner said they had issues with the third party and I needed to cancel and pay in cash. Obviously it was too late to cancel and I was not able to. The two people working there made me feel uncomfortable and were shouting so I had to leave. As I left they demanded the room was ready and I should stay but I could not after the experience. I had traveled across Sri Lanka before this and never experienced anything like this. What made it worse is it was very difficult to get a refund from the provider and I am still struggling.

We were robbed by the owners of the house. We lived on the ground floor between the bathroom and the kitchen. I do not advise anyone. Be careful, hide money. Total unsanitary conditions in the kitchen. Storing food in a horrible refrigerator. This spectacle is shocking. If you suddenly find yourself in this mini-hotel, check the kitchen and where the products are chronicled. I do not recommend this hotel to anyone. God save us.

Nonsense. Told me "no room today" when I got there. I had made a booking in advance online. Told me to look for another place, using their wifi. Their wifi didn't work in the slightest. Save yourself the pain and embarrassment and skip this place

The couple who own the accommodation are very friendly and welcoming. They make you feel right at home. The home cooked buffet is delicious. The location is perfect. 5 mins walk from the beach and 5 mins walk from the harbour. Great value for money!  Would definitely stay again!

we booked 2 nights through booking.com, arrived at middle of a hot day after 3 hours drive from ella, and refused by the owners with the explanation that there are no rooms available and "booking.com made a mistake and its not our fault". very unproffesional. Not acceptable.

We went here for dinner and it was fantastic. Sanjay (I hope I have spelt it right) and his team were brilliant. They looked after us so well. The food was absolutely fantastic, the best meal we have had in Sri Lanka so far. The service was excellent. So friendly and professional. We recommend to anyone.

We had a perfect stay at this boutique hotel. Room decorated with taste, such that we felt quickly at home. Beautiful view from our vila into the thee plantation and forest with many birds.
Our luck that it was low season, so we had plenty of staff to pamper us.
Staff very friendly and provided service with a smile.
Special mentioning of Chef Prasad who prepared with his team fabulous Sri Lankan meals for us, exceeding our expectations every day.
We have to go on diet now.
Good memories of this place!

I highly recommend Kahanda Kanda for any honeymooners, the place is scenic, staff is extremely friendly and accommodating and the food is top notch.

The only issue I had is that internet and cellular network are not the best but this can be considered a good thing if you want to disconnect.

P.S. Better book from them directly as they offer better rates than booking.
Nice and cozy place. ‚ù§Ô∏è staff is so friendly & the have delicious foods ‚ù§Ô∏è

This is one of the best villas collections in Galle and it‚Äôs truly amazing. We loved the peaceful environment since the arrival and the welcome was friendly and nice. We booked this property for our anniversary and luckily we got a room upgrade, to Kumbuk Villa and it was stunning. The villa itself was well equipped and comfortable with all the modern amenities. Pool is one of the best things among it. Only concern we had was the meals, because there was not much variety to select in the set menu and Sri Lankan meals were not available. Other than that meals were delicious and the service was great. We love to visit again and highly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Name: Chandima Beach Waver
Address: Delgaswatta Junction, Midigama, Ahangama, Weligama 81700, Sri Lanka

Reviews.Review Text: Perfect place in Midigame. The upstairs rooms are super modern and you have a nice community area. Loku and his team are super friendly and help you with everything! Stayed there for more than 2 months. Highly recommended and super close to all the nice surf spots.

We had an amazing time in Chandima beach waver. We stayed for 44 days. It felt like our little home in Sri Lanka. Living on the first floor,  where the rooms were new very spacious and bright, we met amazing people that soon became our friends.

Living in the center of Midigama, close to all our favourite surf spots, but just far enough inland to be away from the busy road and busses racing by.

We rented bikes during our whole stay at Chandima beach waver which made it easy to get around.

Coming back from surfing Loku and his sibbelings were always welcoming us with a smile.

Extra plus: the ground floor has a restaurant, so if you feel a bit tired always going out to eat you can order food and eat it in your room.

I stayed at Chandima for 1.5 months ! The upstairs rooms are new & clean & a really good price. Midigama has been the best place to stay as it‚Äôs quieter, beautiful & class expensive than other areas but is close to ahangama & weligama when you need.

Lots of lovely people also staying long term here. The team are so helpful & so nice and I hope to come back again soon. Thankyou for an amazing stay !!

My daughter and I stayed here for 1 month.  We considered ourselves at home here!  Comfortable beds, beautiful balcony space for great yoga sessions, and a friendly, calm environment.
