Close to all beaches and shops and tucked away from the busy road. Thank you Lohu and staff for a most memorable stay.  We highly recommend this accommodation to anyone travelling to Midigama.  Shelley and Erica / Canada

Best stay in Midigama if you are looking for a place that's close to everything but also super relaxed. Rooms are super nice and clean!!! The owner is super friendly and helpful! The food here aswell is amazing! We stayed here over a month and would for sure come back!

Brilliant little beachfront bar and restaurant. In a fantastic spot on the beach, where you can opt to have the waves against your feet at certain times of the year. Decent drinks options, and a good food menu. The calamari was great as a snack, and the fresh fish on offer (you can choose which you fancy from a tray at the front) was spot on - very nicely cooked. Reasonable prices and super helpful and friendly staff

Great place just in front of the ocean with fresh fish. You can enjoy your food with feet in sand and watching the waves. We ordered seafood platter for two, it was really delicious, definitely worth trying. Also, good cocktails and happy hour. The staff is very welcoming and friendly, quick service.

We came here multiple times and had a great time. This place is a vibe with great music and friendly chilled staff !

Food was great and so were the cocktails. In the evening you can pick your own fish! Menu has lots of variety for non fish lovers. The setting is stunning especially as sun goes down. We shared some of our fish we the doggo who joined us for dinner.

This is the most cozy restaurant I have ever been to. The food is really yummy, my favorite is  the Prawns!  üòã

I'm from Egypt and I have eaten prawns in many different recipes, but this recipe is really delicious and I could eat 100 prawns not only 10. üî•‚ù§Ô∏è

The service is really good, all people here are so helpful and friendly!

Can't forget to mention the best location on the beach. üèñÔ∏è

Thank you so much for making my vacation unforgettable. ‚ù§Ô∏è

Really good restaurant close to the sea
The fishes are really good, we went here two days in a row. First one we took a big Cod for 7.5k and the next day another fish (slightly smaller) for 5k.

Recommendable 100% (pictures of other dinners)

Absolutely ugly Enchelada which I waited for 40 minutes. Wasn‚Äôt rolled like it is supposed to be, just two flat tasteless pancakes one above another with sweet carrots in between which absolutely don‚Äôt match the cheese and some peanut topping which doesn‚Äôt fit the dish at all and make all the taste bitter.

Seems like people who cooked it never tried it, otherwise they wouldn‚Äôt be offering this sweet, salt and bitter dish for 2000 Rs or even free.
Service from Youkan was excellent. Affordable prices. Restaurant is highly recommended. Not sure about the accommodation but thanks to the restaurant I‚Äôll be coming back to stay at the hotel too.
Nice place. Fresh fish every day! Perfect grilled calamari and delicious pineapple juice! And of course good staff ü´∂üèª
DELICIOUS vegan poke bowl, portions are massive and very good value for money. Loads of fruits and veggies, and the staff were very kind :))
I had a fantastic stay at this hotel! The location is perfect, rooms are spacious and clean. The bar staff are amazing, serving delicious and affordable food. Highly recommend!

The staff were really nice here so I feel bad to leave a bad review.

However, the hotel is really dated and in desperate need of renovation. Look at my attached photos. The AC only pumped hot air because the condenser is rusted away because it was so old it's right opposite the door, paint peeling off the roofs, holes and paint on the bed sheets etc etc. It doesn't look like the photos, and if you look at the other good reviews they are all left by locals so probably friends of the hotel owner?

If this was a lot cheaper then it would be ok,  but we found a brand new and clean hotel for much less further down the road.

Please update the photos to show how the hotel actually looks it's very misleading.

Had an amazing stay at this hotel! The staff was so friendly and welcoming, as well as incredibly helpful. The location of the hotel was perfect. Not far from the beach and only a few minutes tuktuk ride to both Ahangama and Weligama. Would definitely recommend staying here!

We were only going to stay a week! However, the family who own this small, friendly hotel were so accommodating and genuinely lovely, that we stayed on. We rented a moped and used the hotel as our home. There were only a few other guests who came and went. The chef was amazing and made us special Sri Lankan curries and breakfast was always delicious. It's not your usual resort hotel, it's only 14 rooms, and possessed individuality and a rustic charm. Our bedroom was very large with a high ceiling, and on the balcony we could almost touch the monkeys, monitor lizards, sea eagles, and mongeese. The electric storms at night lit up the entire sky and ocean. We found unspoilt beaches within a mile. In short, we were at home at Ocean Dreams Hotel, and I will be going back. If you like something a little different and you're an independent traveller, please - be their guest. üòä

It's a very poor hotel even don't work television.televisons are very old and when I asked even why they keep it inside room they weren't given a answer.location also very noisy.Don't waste your valuable time and money in this place.You can find thousands of better places than this near by Ahangama.
very nice place, comfortable and quiet! beautiful grounds, and the friendly staff of the hotel leaves the desire to return!

Name: Asanka Surf House & Restaurant
Address: Indhana Road (Near Midigama Railway Station Road 150m), Matara Road, 80650, Sri Lanka

Reviews.Review Text:
Very good people running the place.
Food is great and cheap.
Location is good, and the train is hardly noticeable.
Rooms are good, could get a little hot sometimes . Overall very very recommended to any one , solo or group

Location is just ACE! The staff is lovely, food is amazing - shower & rooms super clean, swimming pool and great chill area. If you‚Äôre looking for a nice place to stay in Midigama this is your spot !

Tip : while travelling please make sure you‚Äôre supporting the local community - this guesthouse is owned & run by a Sri Lankan Family :)

Awesome place, Asanka and his family took great care of us, we spent Christmas there and he made a fantastic spread for us. Very secure, night security. Spent nearly two weeks here and met some great like minded surfers. Super chill and nice rooms, not fancy but clean and plenty good enough for budget conscious surfer travellers. See you again some time I hope Asanka. Yewwwwü§ò

- Great location! A little away from the main road so it's quiet and easing going, but right between and walking distance from 4 great surf spots of midigama. Only close the train track, but the train isn't going that often and hard
- Nice atmosphere and a common area with a view on lazy right surf spot
- Very nice yoga place with good yoga sessions
- Very friendly staf

Nice surf accommodation. Close to lazy left. 2 min walk. Can see waves from 1st floor.   Expect what you are paying for, i.e. It's not a 4star hotel, more like a back packers.

Great place for people learning to surf and the wave in front is very chilled.

Name: Elsewhere Surf Camps Sri Lanka
Address: 291 Weligama By Pass Rd, Weligama 81700, Sri Lanka

Reviews.Review Text:
Wonderful experience! We meant to stay for one week and ended up staying for two...
The instructors are very nice and professional, extra hours activities such as pool sessions and video analysis were super helpful.
Private rooms are spacious and with ac. Food is delicious, see photos :)
The staff are always welcoming, kind and helpful.
I highly recommend, had an amazing time here ü§ô

I spent almost two weeks at elsewhere. It was such a great experience with an awesome atmosphere, chill vibes, diverse people from all around the world. There are many solo travellers of different age group which was really cool. The surfing instructors are great and I appreciated the feedback and theory lessons. Monse captured every wave üì∏The social hosts and staff are so friendly, helpful and honestly just the best. I had an amazing time and totally recommend the place  üåäüèÑ‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è

Nestled along the stunning shores of Weligama, Sri Lanka, lies a hidden gem that promises a surfing experience like no other. My recent stay at this surf camp was nothing short of extraordinary, and I'm thrilled to share my exhilarating adventure with fellow wave enthusiasts.

From the moment I arrived, I was greeted with warm smiles and genuine hospitality. The surf instructors were not only skilled and knowledgeable but also incredibly patient, catering to surfers of all levels with their expert guidance and encouragement. Whether you're a beginner catching your first wave or a seasoned pro looking to refine your skills, these instructors are sure to elevate your surfing game to new heights.

Beyond the waves, the social hosts added an extra layer of magic to the experience. They went above and beyond to ensure that every guest felt welcomed and included, fostering a sense of camaraderie that made the surf camp feel like a home away from home. Their infectious energy and passion for surfing were truly inspiring, creating an atmosphere of positivity and camaraderie that permeated throughout the camp.

And let's not forget about the culinary delights that awaited us after a day of surfing. The delicious meals served at the camp were a delightful fusion of local flavors and international cuisine, satisfying both the palate and the soul.

But the excitement didn't end with the surf sessions and scrumptious meals. The evenings came alive with vibrant parties and lively entertainment, where surfers from all corners of the globe came together to celebrate their shared love for the ocean. From bonfire gatherings on the beach to dance parties under the starlit sky, these unforgettable nights were the perfect way to unwind and connect with fellow surf enthusiasts.

In conclusion, my experience at this surf camp in Weligama, Sri Lanka, was nothing short of magical. With exceptional surf instructors, attentive social hosts, delectable cuisine, and unforgettable parties, this hidden gem is a must-visit destination for anyone seeking the ultimate surfing adventure. Whether you're a novice or a seasoned surfer, this surf camp promises an experience that will leave you craving for more waves and unforgettable memories.

I recently had the pleasure of experiencing the unique charm of Elsewhere Surf Camp in Weligama, and I must say, it's more than just a hostel; it's a lifestyle. From the moment I stepped in, I was captivated by the warm and inviting atmosphere.

Starting with the owner, their passion for creating a holistic experience is evident. They've cultivated a space that seamlessly combines relaxation, fitness, and social interaction. The dedication to ensuring guests have a memorable stay is palpable, and it sets the tone for the entire hostel.

The instructors at Elsewhere are not only experts in surfing and fitness but also exceptional communicators. Although my primary focus was leisure and socializing, the one surfing lesson I had was a blast, thanks to the patient and encouraging instructor(Madhu what an absolute legend). It's evident that the team takes pride in ensuring everyone, regardless of their skill level, has a positive experience.

The support staff, including cleaners and cooks, play a crucial role in maintaining the hostel's welcoming ambiance. The cleanliness is impeccable, creating a comfortable environment that complements the laid-back vibe. The cooks deserve a special mention for their delicious and diverse offerings, catering to various tastes and dietary preferences.

What sets Elsewhere apart is its three-dimensional approach, seamlessly integrating surfing, fitness programs, and socials. Even though I wasn't there for surfing or fitness, the variety of activities added to the overall vibrant atmosphere. The social events were a highlight, providing ample opportunities to connect with fellow travelers in a relaxed setting.

In conclusion, Elsewhere Surf Camp Weligama exceeded my expectations, offering a perfect blend of leisure, socializing, and a touch of adventure. The staff, from the owner to the instructors, cleaners, and cooks, collectively contribute to making this hostel a haven for those seeking a holistic and enjoyable getaway. I wholeheartedly recommend Elsewhere to anyone looking for a memorable and enriching travel experience.
The surf Camp is amazing! Such a very social and fun place. The food is great and all the stuff and surf instructors are very helpful. Even extended my stay.

Probably best all around Sri Lankan cuisine. We had the fried rice, spicy curry, house rice and curry, and potato curry. All very tasty. Short wait time and very attentive staff. Felt very welcoming. The sweet stuff is standout here! From the papaya lassi to the banana coconut chocolate pancake with vanilla ice cream and coconut sprinkle, YES! Wow. Simply amazing. Great way to finish a post surf session feast. I would come back for everything, but I would leave whatever restaurant you‚Äôre eating at to have dessert here.

Food looked exactly like in photos. Loved my banana lassi and it made me cooler after a hot sunny day. Just right amount too. Rice and curry was simple yet delicious. Place was a bit cramped up and rice and curry was comparatively expensive considering the portion provided. Staff were nice and efficient. Got our food and drinks fairly quickly.

During my stay in Weligama (almost two months), Meewitha was the most consistent restaurant, that I visited regularly. Open every single day (hard to find during the off-season), with quality and fresh food. Another plus: Service is usually pretty quick and they even accommodate special requests (check photo). Give it a go, you won't regret it.

Perfect! I had shrimp curry and rice and usually I never eat the whole white rice but the curry was so good that I had to dip the rice into the yellow curry. The shrimp was big and fresh. The spices were perfect. The Papadem was also very fresh and crispy, which is not common :)

The restaurant is on the main road but you do not see the cars, so no disturbing atmosphere.

Edit: I came a second time and I had prawn rice and curry and it was perfect, too. Soo good! (Third picture)

Many thanks!

I used to think my mom makes the best Sri Lankan food but this place changed that. Yet to meet a place that can make delicious dishes like here. They serve generously as well.
Don‚Äôt miss out this place out if you are in Weligama/down south.
Call and check if they are open specially when heading there off season. They respond to texts as well :)

My partner and I just finished a cooking class with Shan and what a delightful experience it was! Both educational and delicious! The best food I have had on my trip to Sri Lanka. Shan cooks with such sincerity and love and you can really taste all that he pours into his cooking. I wish I could eat like this everyday. Highly recommend - it was a highlight of my trip to SL!

Shan is simply the most hospitable man in Sri Lanka, his calm and welcoming energy makes you instantly feel at home, he is so knowledgeable about Ayurveda , best healthy food in weligama, beautiful house, beautiful vibe and beautiful food.
I always go eat at Shans when I am in town!
My Sri Lankan trip would not have been the same without him and his cooking!

Absolutely recommend to do a cooking class with Shan! Authentic, vegan, very tasty Srilankan food, prepared in a 260year old kitchen where Shan‚Äòs grandma already shared her cooking skills with him. If you see cooking as a form of art and food as medicine, you are at the right place!

Just WOW! If you‚Äôre looking for a traditional, authentic and heart warming experience, you‚Äôll find it at Shan‚Äôs beach house. The restaurant is a MUST try, I and all the guests we met have never eaten better in Sri Lanka! We also stayed in his guest room for 2 nights on the attic. It‚Äôs a simple fan room with everything you need. You‚Äôll feel at home ‚ù§Ô∏è Shan made me a natural remedy tea when I had a headache which worked wonders! also, buy his cookbook and definitely do the cooking class. I have never participated in one that was so passionate and I have never learned more than while cooking with Shan!

Shan is such a wonderful, warm and welcoming human. Absolutely loved his vegan cooking class and our conversations over cups of tea. So cool to be cooking in his great grandmother‚Äôs kitchen. Will definitely be back!

One of a Restaurant opened 24 hours in Weligama, foods are average in taste but prices are little high compared to other places in Weligama due to the located place. Mainly targeted foreigners but most of the times locals having meals.
This place is over priced and not good quality. There are so many better places in Weligama than here.

Sooooo i was there many times but with a local guy. Now i wanted to bring my friend there (white girls) and we need to pay a LOT MORE than usual. I don‚Äòt understand that. We payed a lot and they were really angry with us. So we are not c√∂ming again.
sadly they are gonna try to rip you off if you are white! this is really sad because the food is kind of good but i won‚Äôt go there again! really upset now and sad

This was my worst experience in Sri Lanka. They want to rip someone off! I can not understand the good comments, certainly bought. Sad that such a store still exists. I do not recommend this experience to anyone.

Name: Hangtime Hostel
Address: 540 Weligama By Pass Rd, Weligama 81700, Sri Lanka

Reviews.Review Text:
Best non-local food I had in my whole time in Sri Lanka. I can really recommend the chicken/falafel wrap & the vegan loaded fries were absolutely delicious & super filling.
It‚Äôs a good priced menu, the staff contributed to a comfortable atmosphere, & the restaurant has a great view of the surf‚Ä¶ not to mention the casual chill space downstairs where u can relax & get some reading done ‚ú®

The best place to grab a burger in Weligama.

Amazing atmosphere during the evenings, mouthwatering food and great options for drinks and smoothies.

They also have a mean fish and chips where the fries looked hand cut and tasted amazing.

And the beef burger was so good it took me back to when McDonald's had a good big Mac.

Great place for foreigners and locals where both people were treated the same. Something other businesses should learn from these days.

This is a must visit place in Weligama. Highly recommend the beef burger üçî

Love this place ever since I‚Äôve came to Sri Lanka. The location is fantastic with perfect view to the bay you can overlook the surfers surf. Also it‚Äôs super refreshing up here on the rooftop it‚Äôs windy and it‚Äôs easy to chill with a good juice or super tasty food.

The service is amazing, I had never a day where the staff didn‚Äôt gave 100% so that every customer is happy. The little moments count and the staff from hangtime makes this place feel welcoming and heartwarming besides the amazing location. Special thanks to Nadun he‚Äôs always smiling, super helpful and fast.

Overall a great place to come every day have your coffee and enjoy the island vibes.
Big thanks to the owners for creating a place like this.

Had a great experience at Hangtime. The view over Weligama bay is stunning. Great vibe, really good and tasty food and there is something for everyone. A very relaxed vibe from a great team, nothing too much trouble and Nadun was super helpful. And with regular live music on the top floor it's a great place to 'hang' out.

My favourite hostel in Weligama. I spent 3 months in Sri Lanka and kept coming back to this hostel because it just has a great vibe. The rooms are nice and big and clean and all the staff are just lovely. You are right on the surf beach and from the restaurant on the roof terrace you have a great view over Weligama Bay. I will definitely come back.

Name: Catamaran Restaurant
Address: Weligama By Pass Rd, Sri Lanka

Reviews.Review Text: there were not many people, but we had to wait a very long time for food, even longer for coffee. no one is in a rush. The seafood kottu was made of prawns and chicken. Bit the place- nice
Great restaurant on the beach. Excellent menu for breakfast, lunch and dinner. Really fresh food with good service.
I had the fish Kankun (#172) Hands down the best thing I‚Äôve eaten in Sri Lanka! Bite sized fried fish marinated in a local sauce first, served with greens & onions.

Can't beat the location, overlooking a popular surf point and lovely stretch of beach. Friendly staff and tasty food, good portions. Plenty of seating inside the restaurant and on the beach. Always visit for a strong cup of local coffee and the view.
Sumith was a hard-working soul and has left the place in the capable hands of his daughter and family. They continue to do a good job in their landmark truck.

I had a fantastic experience at this restaurant
! The staff was incredibly friendly, always ready to help with a smile

Name: Luvi Lucas River Side
Address: XCGP+JCW, Gangarama Cross Rd, Weligama, Sri Lanka

Reviews.Review Text:
This place is amazing !
The rooms are comfy with everything you need. The house boat is really enjoyable and the family is so so kind. I recommend you to stay here in Weligama :)
(I stayed for 5 weeks)

A lovely place to stay in.
The whole family was all so very kind and caring.
The morning smoothie was delicious üòã
We eat breakfast every day next to the river.
Rooms are big, includs A/C and a fan.
My kids loved playing with Kal the dog.
Highly recommended stay.
Came for 1 day, ended up staying nearly two weeks. Great and quiet location. The rooms and balcony are great. Breakfast is tasty and varied, but could be a bit more.

The location was so nice and quiet, away from all the noise of Weligama town but still close enough to get to it it you want to go to restaurants and bars. What sets this place apart is definitely the owners, a Sri Lankan family with true Sri Lankan hospitality at the heart. The Mum, dad and son who run this place are so kind and welcoming. The food is done if the best I've had in over 2 months in Sri Lanka besides my own family (I am half Sri Lankan!) so be sure to choose the "Sri Lankan breakfast" option in the mornings. We even booked in to come back for dinner after checking out.

This place is a real, authentic gem in the south coast.

Best value for money food we have found so far in Weligama!
Owned by a family, has a cool floating terrace to enjoy your food and they also available to do takeaway.
